headline.main: AFFAIRS AT FORT PICKENS.; Interesting Details of the Condition of Both Camps. Letter from Mr. W.H. Russell, Special Correspondent of the London Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our little schooner lay quietly at the wharf all night, but no one was allowed to come on board without a pass, for these wild-looking sentries are excellent men of business, and look after the practical part of soldiering with all the keenness which their direct personal interest imparts...

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM THE ANTILLES.; NEWS BY THE DE SOTO. UPRISING AGAINST THE SPANISH IN ST. DOMINGO MASSACRE BY SPANISH TROOPS. Loss of the Steamship Zulu--Commercial Intelligence, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: We are indebted to Mr. G.A. FULLER, Purser of the De Soto, for the follewing important news. The De Soto, JOHN JOHNSON, Commander, arrived yesterday from Havana, which port she left on the 20th inst., at 4 P.M., making the quick run to Sandy Hook in 3 days 15 hours.

docs.snippet: Col. CLARENCE SEWARD has declined the appointment of Major in the regular Army.

headline.main: THE GREAT INSURRECTION.; INTERESTING NEWS FROM WASHINGTON. Strengthening the Federal Lines in Virginia. A Balloon Reconnoisance by Prof. Lowe. The Condition of Affairs at Harper's Ferry. Five Thousand Rebels Still at Martinsburgh. GREAT DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY THERE Forty-five Locomotives and Numbers of Gondolas and Cars Burnt. The Rebel Scouts Withdrawn from Williamsport. LATEST INTELLIGENCE FROM MISSOURI. Good Effects of the Battle of Booneville. How the Rebels were Informed of the Advance on Great Bethel. THE REASON WHY. CONTRABAND MOVEMENTS. THE NEW-YORK SEVENTH DOINGS OF THE VIRGINIA REBELS. BUSINESS ON THE RIVER. THE MARYLAND LEGISLATURE. ARRIVAL OF THE THIRTY-SEVENTH. THE IMPLICATION OF MINISTER HARVEY. THE EXTRA SESSION OF CONGRESS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Col. CLARENCE SEWARD has declined the appointment of Major in the regular Army.

docs.snippet: No movement of importance among the Federal troops, aside from the ordinary arrivals and departures, appears to have taken place in the vicinity of Washington yesterday. Our lines are being strengthened daily whenever such a proceeding seems...
docs.lead_paragraph: No movement of importance among the Federal troops, aside from the ordinary arrivals and departures, appears to have taken place in the vicinity of Washington yesterday. Our lines are being strengthened daily whenever such a proceeding seems necessary, and will doubtless soon be, if they are not already, in a condition to withstand the onset of the fifty thousand rebel troops which are reported to be ready to attempt the capture of the Capital.

headline.main: DETAILS OF THE BATTLE OF BOONEVILLE.; HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF THE WEST, THE GREAT INSURRECTION.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamers A McDowell, Iatan and City of Louisiana, left Jefferson City yesterday afternoon at 2 o'clock, and reached a point a mile below Provi- dence last night, where it was thought best to lay up a few hours.
